ShadowRootSetHTMLUnsafe.summary:
The setHTMLUnsafe() method of the interface is used to parse a string of HTML into a , which then replaces the element's subtree in the DOM.
The input HTML may include declarative shadow roots.

remarks.para: The suffix "Unsafe" in the method name indicates that the method does not sanitize or remove potentially unsafe XSS-relevant input, such as <script> elements, and script or event handler content attributes.

If the string of HTML defines more than one declarative shadow root in a particular shadow host then only the first is created â€” subsequent declarations are parsed as <template> elements within that shadow root.

blockquote.para: This method should be used instead of when a string of HTML may contain declarative shadow roots.
